LB106.name: Preparation for Science and Engineering
LB106.description: Academic and environmental aspects to college success. Review of math and science fundamentals and development of writing skills. Introduction to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) careers.
LB106.restrictions: Open to freshmen. Approval of college.

LB117.name: Functions and Trigonometry
LB117.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB117.description: Rational and real numbers; functions and inverses. Equations and systems of equations. Inequalities; graphing; trigonometry; and coordinate geometry. Exponential and logarithmic functions.
LB117.prerequisite: (MTH 103) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test
LB117.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB118.name: Calculus I
LB118.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB118.description: Limits, continuity, differentiation, integration, and elementary applications.
LB118.prerequisite: (LB 117 or MTH 114 or MTH 116) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test
LB118.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB119.name: Calculus II
LB119.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB119.description: Continuation of LB 118. Integration techniques, elementary differential equations, parametric curves, polar coordinates, sequences and series, vectors, and vector operations.
LB119.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB133.name: Introduction to History, Philosophy, and Sociology of Science
LB133.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB133.description: Introduction to the history, philosophy, and sociology of science, technology, the environment, and medicine. Instruction and practice in formal writing.
LB133.prerequisite: Designated score on English Placement test
LB133.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB144.name: Biology I: Organismal Biology
LB144.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB144.description: Modern biology at the organismal level of integration. Principles of genetics, evolution, ecology, and organismal diversity as interactive units.
LB144.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.
LB144.exclude: BS 162 or BS 172 or BS 182H or BS 192H

LB145.name: Biology II: Cellular and Molecular Biology
LB145.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB145.description: Modern biology, mainly at the cellular level of integration. Principles of cell structure and function used to explain processes of bioenergetics, protein synthesis, and development.
LB145.prerequisite: {LB 144 or (BS 162 and BS 172) or (BS 182H and BS 192H)} and (LB 171 or CEM 141 or CEM 181H or CEM 151)
LB145.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.
LB145.exclude: BS 161 or BS 171 or BS 181H or BS 191H

LB155.name: Introduction to Quantitative Science and Research
LB155.description: Exploration of fundamental chemistry, biology, physics, mathematics and statistics. Quantitative analysis and research.
LB155.restrictions: Open to freshmen in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB171.name: Principles of Chemistry I
LB171.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB171.description: Stoichiometry, quantum mechanics and interactions of light with matter, periodic trends, Lewis dot structures, molecular structure, polarity and intermolecular forces, valence bond theory, introduction to organic chemistry, enthalpy and heat transfer.
LB171.prerequisite: MTH 114 or (MTH 116 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 133 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently) or (LB 117 or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently) or (LB 119 or concurrently)
LB171.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB171L.name: Introductory Chemistry Laboratory I
LB171L.description: Determination of density and molecular weight. Stoichometry. Acid-base titration, redox titration. Reaction kinetics, thermochemistry, Beer's law, freezing point depression, and equilibrium constants.
LB171L.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB172.name: Principles of Chemistry II
LB172.description: Gases, properties of solutions, introduction to solid state chemistry, molecular orbital theory, chemical equilibria, chemical kinetics, acid/base equilibria, solubility equilibria, entropy, free energy, electrochemistry, redox reactions, nuclear chemistry.
LB172.prerequisite: LB 171 or CEM 141 or CEM 151 or CEM 181H
LB172.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB172L.name: Principles of Chemistry II - Reactivity Laboratory
LB172L.description: Synthesis and characterization of chemical systems.
LB172L.prerequisite: (LB 171 or CEM 141 or CEM 152 or CEM 182H) and (LB 171L or CEM 161 or CEM 185H)
LB172L.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB181.name: Introduction to Science, Technology, the Environment and Public Policy
LB181.description: Relation of science and technology to ethics and public policy. Environmental law and public policy. Managing fish, water and wildlife resources at state, national, and international levels. Science and technology in developing countries. Impacts of military technology on environmental policy.

LB181H.name: Honors Cell and Molecular Biology
LB181H.description: Physicochemical and molecular organization of cells as the unifying framework for genetics, evolution, and the social relevance of biology.
LB181H.prerequisite: (CEM 141 or concurrently) or (CEM 151 or concurrently) or (CEM 181H or concurrently) or (LB 171 or concurrently)

LB182H.name: Honors Organismal and Population Biology
LB182H.description: Diversity and basic properties of organisms, with emphasis on genetic principles, ecological interactions, and the evolutionary process. Historical approach to knowledge discovery.

LB191H.name: Honors Cell and Molecular Biology Laboratory
LB191H.description: Basic techniques of cellular and molecular biology including experimental design and hypothesis formulation; biochemistry, molecular biology and genetics.

LB192H.name: Honors Organismal and Population Biology Laboratory
LB192H.description: Nature and process of organismal biology, including experimental design and statistical methods, hypothesis testing, genetics, ecology, and evolution.

LB220.name: Calculus III
LB220.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB220.description: Continuation of LB 119. Differential calculus of functions of two or three variables. Double and triple integrals. Line and surface integrals.
LB220.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB240.name: Bioethics: Theories and Methods
LB240.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
LB240.description: Interdisciplinary survey of key theories and methods in bioethics. Topics include aging, cultural diversity, and health care policy.

LB268.name: The Business of Medicine
LB268.description: Introductory theories, concepts, and processes for policy and organization in health care. Business modeling for medical practice.
LB268.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

LB270.name: Medical Terminology
LB270.description: Medical terminology, focusing on human systems, anatomy and physiology, fundamental word building principles, and phonetic pronunciations.

LB273.name: Physics I
LB273.description: Basic physics principles and problem solving techniques. Mechanical systems (Newton’s laws, momentum and energy conservation, rotational motion, gravity), elementary thermodynamics, oscillations and waves, and atomic nuclei. Laboratory techniques, instrumentation, and selected experiments in classical and modern physics.
LB273.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.
LB273.exclude: PHY 183 or PHY 231 or PHY 193h or PHY 191 or PHY 251

LB274.name: Physics II
LB274.description: Basic physics principles and problem solving techniques. Principles of electromagnetic theory, circuits, special relativity, quantum physics, optics, atomic and subatomic physics. Laboratory error analysis and selected experiments in classical and modern physics.
LB274.prerequisite: LB 273 or PHY 183 or PHY 183B or PHY 193H or PHY 233B
LB274.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.
LB274.exclude: PHY 184 or PHY 232 or PHY 294h or PHY 192 or PHY 252

LB290A.name: Directed Study-Multidisciplinary
LB290A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB290A.description: Directed studies involving at least two Lyman Briggs College curricular areas
LB290A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB290B.name: Directed Study--Biology
LB290B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB290B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB290C.name: Directed Study--Chemistry/Physics
LB290C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB290C.description: Directed studies in chemistry and physics.
LB290C.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB290D.name: Directed Study--Mathematics
LB290D.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB290D.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB290E.name: Directed Study--History, Philosophy, and Sociology of Science
LB290E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LB290E.description: Directed study in history, philosophy, and sociology of science.
LB290E.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB290F.name: Directed Study--Computing
LB290F.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB290F.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB304.name: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer (LGBTQ) and Sexuality Studies
LB304.description: Interdisciplinary study of the history, politics, theories, science, cultures, and communities of lesbian, gay, transgender, queer, and intersex people including a global perspective.

LB321A.name: Science and the Public - Arts and Humanities (W)
LB321A.description: Interdisciplinary study of the relationship between science and society, public engagement with science and technology, public expressions of scientific knowledge, and science in culture. Emphasis on scholarship in the arts and humanities.
LB321A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB321A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB321B.name: Science and the Public - Social Sciences (W)
LB321B.description: Interdisciplinary study of the relationship between science and society, public engagement with science and technology, public expressions of scientific knowledge, and science in culture. Emphasis on scholarship in the social sciences.
LB321B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB321B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB322A.name: Advances in Science and Technology - Arts and Humanities (W)
LB322A.description: Interdisciplinary study of technology and innovation. Emphasis on methodologies, scholarship, and theoretical approaches from the arts and humanities.
LB322A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB322A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB322B.name: Advances in Science and Technology - Social Sciences (W)
LB322B.description: Interdisciplinary study of technology and innovation in relation to science and/or medicine. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the social sciences.
LB322B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB322B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB323A.name: Science in a Global Context - Arts and Humanities (W)
LB323A.description: Explores scientific practice and relevance in a global context. Emphasis on scholarship from the arts and humanities.
LB323A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB323A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB323B.name: Science in a Global Context - Social Sciences (W)
LB323B.description: Explores scientific practice and relevance in a global context. Emphasis on scholarship from the social sciences.
LB323B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB323B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB324A.name: Science and Sex, Gender, Sexuality - Arts and Humanities (W)
LB324A.description: Interdisciplinary study of sex, gender, and sexuality in relation to science and/or medicine. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the arts and humanities.
LB324A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB324A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB324B.name: Science and Sex, Gender, Sexuality - Social Sciences (W)
LB324B.description: Interdisciplinary study of sex, gender, and sexuality in relation to science and/or medicine. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the social sciences.
LB324B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB324B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB325A.name: Science and the Environment - Arts and Humanities (W)
LB325A.description: Interdisciplinary study of how and why humans have transformed their environments, as well as changes in people’s attitudes about nature and wilderness over time. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the arts and humanities.
LB325A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB325A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB325B.name: Science and the Environment - Social Sciences (W)
LB325B.description: Interdisciplinary study of the interrelationship between human systems and natural systems, including human drivers of environmental impact and solutions to environmental problems. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the social sciences.
LB325B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB325B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB326A.name: Medicine and Health - Arts and Humanities (W)
LB326A.description: Interdisciplinary study of health and medicine. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the arts and humanities.
LB326A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB326A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB326B.name: Medicine and Health - Social Sciences (W)
LB326B.description: Interdisciplinary study of health and medicine. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the social sciences.
LB326B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB326B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB327A.name: Scientific Practice - Arts and Humanities (W)
LB327A.description: Motivations and methodologies of the scientific endeavor, as well as the institutions that support it. Historical perspectives on the development of scientific practice, ethical implications of scientific work, and the impact of cultural practices, norms, and identities on scientific innovation. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the arts and humanities.
LB327A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB327A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB327B.name: Scientific Practice - Social Sciences (W)
LB327B.description: Explores the motivations and methodologies of scientific endeavors and the relationships between science and other major human institutions such as religion, politics, government, and the economy. Emphasis on scholarship and methodologies from the social sciences.
LB327B.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB327B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Minor.

LB330.name: Topics in History, Philosophy, and Sociology of Science (W)
LB330.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of odd years
LB330.description: Topics in history, philosophy, and sociology of science, technology, the environment, and medicine.
LB330.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB330.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB331.name: Literature and Science (W)
LB331.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB331.description: Representations of science, technology, the environment, and medicine in texts drawn from science fiction, Gothic, and utopian literature, or mainstream writings.
LB331.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB331.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB332.name: Technology and Culture (W)
LB332.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB332.description: History of technology with special emphasis on the interaction of technical innovation and other elements of culture.
LB332.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB332.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the American Studies major or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB333.name: Topics in History of Science (W)
LB333.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB333.description: Various themes or periods in physical/biological science. May emphasize patterns of theory development, changes in explanatory aims and standards or interaction of social and cultural factors with scientific ideas, practices, instrumentation or experimentalism.
LB333.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB333.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB334.name: Science, Technology, and Public Policy (W)
LB334.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of every year
LB334.description: Formation, implementation, and evaluation of public policy related to science, technology, the environment, and medicine.
LB334.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB334.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB335.name: The Natural Environment: Perceptions and Practices (W)
LB335.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of every year
LB335.description: American attitudes toward the natural environment and related public and private institutions.
LB335.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB335.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the American Studies major or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB336.name: Gender, Sexuality, Science, Technology (W)
LB336.description: Significance of gender in relation to science, technology, the environment, and medicine.
LB336.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB336.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB348.name: Research Experiences in Biology
LB348.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB348.description: Laboratory, data science, or field research in basic or applied molecular, cellular, or organismal biology. Field trips required.
LB348.prerequisite: {(LB 144 and LB 145) or (BS 161 and BS 162 and BS 171 and BS 172) or (BS 181H and BS 182H and BS 191H and BS 192H)} and ((LB 119 or STT 231) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)
LB348.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB355.name: Philosophy of Technology (W)
LB355.description: Examination of the desirability of technology, its social forms, and its alternatives. Conventional productivist, ecological progressive, and radical humanist outlooks.
LB355.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB355.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Philosophy or in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB368.name: Science, Technology, and Society
LB368.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB368.description: Role of science and technology in social change. Values and ethics in contemporary perspectives, controversies, and cases. Science and technology as forms of knowledge.
LB368.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

LB425.name: American and European Health Care since 1800
LB425.description: Social and cultural transformation in health care delivery since 1800, primarily in North America and western Europe. Therapeutic revolutions. Medical education and professionalization. Social and alternative medicine. Managed care.
LB425.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.

LB440.name: Bioethics Capstone
LB440.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB440.description: Selective topics in bioethics. Analysis of key issues and problems. Case studies.
LB440.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Bioethics, Humanities, and Society Minor.

LB459.name: Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Capstone
LB459.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB459.description: Selected topics in science, technology, environment and public policy (STEPPS). Analysis of key issues and problems. Case studies.
LB459.prerequisite: (FW 181 or approval of college) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

LB473A.name: Literature and Medicine
LB473A.description: Human dimensions of medicine as seen in literature. Health, illness, mortality. Medical dilemmas. Physical and psychological self. Psychological theories used in interpreting literature. Cultural history of the body. Theories of embodiment.
LB473A.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
LB473A.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

LB490A.name: Advanced Directed Study--Multidisciplinary
LB490A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB490A.description: Directed advanced studies involving at least two Lyman Briggs College curricular areas
LB490A.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB490B.name: Advanced Directed Study--Biology
LB490B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
LB490B.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB490E.name: Advanced Directed Study--History, Philosophy, Sociology of Science (W)
LB490E.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LB490E.description: Directed advanced studies in history, philosophy, sociology of science, technology, the environment, or medicine.
LB490E.prerequisite: (LB 133) or completion of Tier I writing requirement
LB490E.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College or in the Science, Technology, Environment and Public Policy Specialization.

LB492.name: Senior Seminar (W)
LB492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LB492.description: Selected problems in the study of science and technology as human activities, using philosophical, historical, literary, social science or interdisciplinary perspectives or methods. Development and defense of thesis paper or project.
LB492.prerequisite: ((LB 321A or concurrently) or (LB 321B or concurrently) or (LB 322A or concurrently) or (LB 322B or concurrently) or (LB 323A or concurrently) or (LB 323B or concurrently) or (LB 324A or concurrently) or (LB 324B or concurrently) or (LB 325A or concurrently) or (LB 325B or concurrently)) or ((LB 326A or concurrently) or (LB 326B or concurrently) or (LB 327A or concurrently) or (LB 327B or concurrently))
LB492.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB493.name: Field Experience
LB493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
LB493.description: Experiential learning related to the public or private practice of science and technology.
LB493.restrictions: Open to students in the Lyman Briggs College.

LB494.name: Undergraduate Research
LB494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
